column5: would like some tips on a smaller resort (cabins) for fishing walleye, pike and smallies within a 3 hour drive from Thunder Bay or Fort Frances? Heading up 1st week of September. Like all, would like something productive.
I would suggest cedar lake at Purrault falls. We stay at cedar point resort. It's off the road a couple of miles and quiet. It's located right in the middle of the lake.

We went to one of the Kabeelo lodge lakes a few years ago, loved it, and are going back in three weeks. Some of their lakes are pretty small. The fly out lakes though are housekeeping cabins with food provided, so not really a lodge. They do have an American plan lodge on their home lake, which has pike and lake trout but no walleye. It's a beautiful lake, but I don't know much about the fishing beyond that.
